title: When a shrinking job market isn’t so bad
itunes:title: When a shrinking job market isn’t so bad
itunes:author: Marketplace / Kai Ryssdal
description: The number of job openings dipped 10% between July and August — a bigger drop than many economists predicted. It might show that the imbalance between supply and demand for labor is shrinking, and could be a sign that the Fed’s rate hikes are working. Plus, how workers are “performing” productivity, why importers are struggling to take advantage of a strong dollar, and when will this bear market finally end?
